revised_title: Thermometrical Observations at the Royal Society: Reduction and Analysis
tldr: The author, James Glaisher, analyzes the thermometrical observations made at the Royal Society from 1774 to 1843. He examines the accuracy and reliability of the data, applies corrections to the observations, and presents the results in a usable format. Glaisher also compares the mean temperatures of different seasons and years, highlighting the variations and trends in the data.
